articles.headline: Clerk Who Questioned $20 Bill Watched Floyd Arrest With ‘Disbelief and Guilt’
articles.snippet: During the third day of Derek Chauvin’s trial, witness after witness agonized over whether they could have done anything to stop what would eventually happen to George Floyd.
articles.abstract: During the third day of Derek Chauvin’s trial, witness after witness agonized over whether they could have done anything to stop what would eventually happen to George Floyd.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — He chatted with a store clerk about playing football. He grabbed a banana off a shelf, flipped through a wad of cash, and hugged and exchanged pleasantries with a woman, laughing with his hand on her back.
articles.byline: By John Eligon, Shaila Dewan, Tim Arango and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs

articles.headline: An Accidental Disclosure Exposes a $1 Billion Tax Fight With Bristol Myers
articles.snippet: The I.R.S. believes the American drugmaker used an abusive offshore scheme to avoid federal taxes.
articles.abstract: The I.R.S. believes the American drugmaker used an abusive offshore scheme to avoid federal taxes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Almost nine years ago, Bristol Myers Squibb filed paperwork in Ireland to create a new offshore subsidiary. By moving Bristol Myers’s profits through the subsidiary, the American drugmaker could substantially reduce its U.S. tax bill.

articles.headline: ‘They Told Us Not to Resist’: Sexual Violence Pervades Ethiopia’s War
articles.snippet: Rape is being used as a weapon as fighting rages in remote parts of Tigray region. “Even if we had shouted,” one woman said, “there was no one to listen.”
articles.abstract: Rape is being used as a weapon as fighting rages in remote parts of Tigray region. “Even if we had shouted,” one woman said, “there was no one to listen.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Mona Lisa lay on a hospital bed in Mekelle, the main city in war-torn northern Ethiopia, her body devastated but her defiance on display.

articles.headline: That Spotty Wi-Fi? There’s $100 Billion to Fix It.
articles.snippet: President Biden's infrastructure proposal aims to close the digital divide, which has existed since the Clinton administration.
articles.abstract: President Biden's infrastructure proposal aims to close the digital divide, which has existed since the Clinton administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Kimberly Vasquez, a high school senior in Baltimore, faced a tough problem when the pandemic began. She had no fast internet service in her home, but all her classes were online.

articles.headline: Wall Street Hits Another Record, Lifted by Tech Rally and Economic Optimism
articles.snippet: Gains were largely driven by technology shares, and the record close was the latest in a series of new highs for the S&P 500.
articles.abstract: Gains were largely driven by technology shares, and the record close was the latest in a series of new highs for the S&P 500.
articles.lead_paragraph: A rally in big technology stocks, a tailwind of optimism from the Biden administration’s latest spending plan and a jump in oil prices combined on Thursday to lift Wall Street to another record, this one punctuated by the S&P 500 index’s close above 4,000 for the first time.
articles.byline: By Matt Phillips and Mohammed Hadi
